item.title: Covid: More pinged workers eligible for daily tests instead of isolation
item.description: Waste workers, prison staff and defence workers will be able to avoid isolation, the government says.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Dean takes gold & Duncan Scott silver for GB in 200m freestyle
item.description: Tom Dean claims a stunning gold and Duncan Scott silver to ensure a British one-two finish in a thrilling 200m freestyle at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Britain's Georgia Taylor-Brown wins silver in women's triathlon
item.description: Great Britain's Georgia Taylor-Brown fights back from a bike puncture to earn an Olympic silver medal in the women's triathlon.

item.title: Parkour athlete: 'She wants to be a doctor so she can fix me'
item.description: Luke Callinan, 35, has been diagnosed with a rare form of multiple sclerosis.

item.title: Whipps Cross Hospital cancels operations after flooding
item.description: Appointments at Whipps Cross have also been rearranged with some to be held virtually.

item.title: Mum hit by car at Denbighshire festival as daughter, 2, thrown to safety
item.description: "I genuinely believed my whole family had died", says Jenna O'Neill, who suffered serious injuries.

item.title: Bewdley to get £6.2m permanent flood defences
item.description: The new barriers for Bewdley follow the breaching of temporary defences twice in 12 months.

item.title: Olly Stephens: Two boys guilty of teen's murder
item.description: Olly Stephens, 13, was lured by a girl to a field where he was attacked by two 14-year-olds.

item.title: Somerset fossil hunters 'need to be better informed'
item.description: A resident said he wants to help raise awareness of laws and safety around fossil hunting.

item.title: Tara Hanlon jailed for over £5m money laundering offences
item.description: Tara Hanlon was found to have five suitcases stuffed with cash at Heathrow Airport in October 2020.

item.title: Idles to give 2,000 free Bristol concert tickets to NHS staff
item.description: The event's promoter said the band wanted to show the NHS their "love and thanks".

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Weed garden wins RHS gold at Tatton Park flower show
item.description: The team behind Weed Thriller want to show that native plants are essential for wildlife.

item.title: Chess: The 12-year-old boy taking the game by storm
item.description: "Shrez" has been playing chess since he was five and wants to become world champion one day.

item.title: Mental health: Derbyshire man pulls sack of coal to Newcastle
item.description: Ben Robertson pulls coal 120 miles to Newcastle to raise awareness of mental health.

item.title: The young imam using Instagram to change opinions
item.description: Sabah Ahmedi wants to show imams can "have a laugh", have "a bit of banter" and "wear colourful socks".

item.title: 'People have never seen anything like this before'
item.description: Live-streamed footage of a family of blue tits has had more than 41 million views online.

item.title: What's happened on day four at Tokyo 2020?
item.description: Tom Dean takes gold ahead of compatriot Duncan Scott, while Georgia Taylor-Brown wins triathlon silver as Great Britain's strong start to the Tokyo Games continues.

item.title: Tom Dean: Swimmer's family and friends celebrate his 200m freestyle gold
item.description: Watch what happened when Team GB swimmer Tom Dean's family and friends gathered in his mum's garden to watch him in the 200m freestyle final at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Bianca Walkden suffers defeat in taekwondo semi-final
item.description: Great Britain's Bianca Walkden suffers a last-gasp defeat by South Korea's Lee Da-bin in the Olympic taekwondo +67kg semi-final.

item.title: The Hundred: Alex Hales leads Trent Rockets to unlikely, thrilling victory over Northern Superchargers
item.description: Alex Hales capitalises on a Ben Stokes drop to lead Trent Rockets to a thrilling, unlikely two-wicket victory over Northern Superchargers.
